intro: Coffea horsfieldiana, commonly known as the Horsfield's coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the island of Java in Indonesia and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds used for coffee. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 2 to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
